menu.commands

Class SaveAsCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • menu.commands.SaveAsCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command

    public class SaveAsCommand
extends java.lang.Object
implements Command
    The SaveAsCommand class implements the Command interface to save the changes made to the table to a specified file. This command allows the user to specify the path of the file to save the table's contents. 
     
 Table table = new Table(new TypeChecker());
 Writer writer = new TextFileWriter();
 SaveAsCommand saveAsCommand = new SaveAsCommand(writer, table);
 saveAsCommand.execute(new String[] {"saveas", "newFile.csv"});
    Since:
    2024-06-24

    • Constructor Detail

      • SaveAsCommand

        public SaveAsCommand(Writer writer,
                     Table table)
        Constructs a SaveAsCommand with the specified Writer and Table.
        Parameters:
        writer - the writer to be used for saving the table
        table - the table whose contents are to be saved

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute(java.lang.String[] data)
             throws ClosedFileException
        Executes the save as command. This method performs the following steps:
        1. Checks if the table's file is open.
        2. Saves the specified file name in a new variable.
        3. The writer writes the table's contents to the specified file.
        4. Displays an appropriate message depending on whether and what kind of error was encountered.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface Command
        Parameters:
        data - an array of command parts
        Throws:
        ClosedFileException - if the table's file is closed
